title: No F-35 jets from US for India? Govt mulls next steps after 25% tariff shock
content: India is exploring options to address US President Trump's 25 per cent tariff on Indian goods, but immediate retaliation is unlikely. While aiming to maintain trade relations by potentially increasing imports of natural gas, communication equipment, and gold from the US, India has ruled out new defense purchases, including the F-35 fighter jets.

title: Rape case: How Prajwal Revanna reacted in court after conviction
content: Prajwal Revanna, grandson of former Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda, was convicted Friday in Bengaluru in a rape case involving a domestic help. The special court found him guilty of raping the woman at his farmhouse in 2021, acts allegedly recorded on his phone.

title: Charred bodies of siblings found in Patna house
content: In a shocking incident in Patna's Nagwan village, two schoolgoing siblings were found burned alive inside their home. Police suspect a premeditated murder, as the children were allegedly killed before the house was set ablaze.

title: Billionaire Harsh Goenka on Trump's 25% tariff on India: No need to panic
content: Following US President Trump's announcement of a 25% tariff on Indian goods, Billionaire Harsh Goenka has urged calm, emphasizing India's ability to adapt and thrive. Goenka suggests viewing the tariff as an opportunity to strengthen trade ties with ASEAN nations and Europe, leveraging the 'China+1' shift.

title: Dalit techie’s murder: Woman's father arrested in Tamil Nadu
content: In Tamil Nadu, a sub-inspector named Saravanan has been arrested concerning the alleged honour killing of Kavin Selvaganesh, a 23-year-old Dalit software engineer. Saravanan is the father of Surjith, the primary suspect accused of murdering Kavin for his relationship with Surjith's sister, S Subashini. Subashini has denied her parents' involvement, stating they planned to reveal the relationship later.

title: ‘Dead economy’ remark: Rijiju’s ‘not a child’ jibe at Rahul ; calls out ‘anti-India’ stance
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju criticized Rahul Gandhi for echoing Donald Trump's "dead economy" remarks, deeming it an "anti-India" stance. Rijiju urged Gandhi to act with the dignity expected of an opposition leader, rather than attacking the government. Gandhi had listed reasons for India's economic decline, blaming Modi's policies and alleging favoritism towards Adani.

title: Heroic rescue: 7 Indians in Singapore pull woman from 3ft sinkhole
content: Seven Indian migrant workers, hailed as heroes for rescuing a woman from a sinkhole in Singapore, have been invited to meet President Tharman Shanmugaratnam. Their swift action, praised by the President and the Ministry of Manpower, has also highlighted concerns about migrant worker conditions, including low wages and potential exploitation, in Singapore.

title: How China's DeepSeek made Meta CEO lose faith in Meta's AI team
content: Mark Zuckerberg is under pressure to justify Meta's massive AI investments as the company's profit growth slows. Following the disappointing performance of Llama 4, Zuckerberg initiated a secretive "Superintelligence lab," poaching top AI talent with lucrative offers. Investors are cautiously optimistic, but concerns remain about the escalating costs and the shift away from open-source AI.

title: Duleep Trophy: Rahane, Pujara ignored from West Zone squad; Shardul named captain
content: West Zone selectors have sidelined veterans Ajinkya Rahane and Cheteshwar Pujara for the Duleep Trophy, dimming their hopes for an India comeback. Shardul Thakur will lead the team, which includes Yashasvi Jaiswal, Shreyas Iyer, and Sarfaraz Khan. Ravindra Jadeja is rested, while Rahane's recent T20 form and expressed desire for Test cricket weren't enough to secure his place.

title: 'India cannot remain mute spectator': Congress targets govt over Trump tariffs
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has strongly criticized the Centre's silence regarding US President Donald Trump's 25% tariff imposition on Indian exports. Ramesh argues that Trump's actions have undermined the WTO and other international agreements, leaving India vulnerable.

title: Ex-Maha CM opposes 'saffron terror' term; says use 'Hindu terrorism' instead
content: Former Maharashtra CM Prithviraj Chavan opposes the term "saffron terror," associating saffron with revered figures and symbols. This statement follows the acquittal of all accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case due to lack of evidence. Chavan also countered Amit Shah's claim about Hindus and terrorism, reminding him of Nathuram Godse.

title: Elon Musk clarifies: ‘I don’t have personal loans at this time against Tesla stock’
content: Elon Musk refuted claims about having loans against his Tesla shares and voiced concerns about potentially losing control of the company. He highlighted the tax implications of exercising stock options and the limited increase in voting control. Musk fears that reduced control could allow activist investors to compromise public safety in Tesla's AI and robotics projects.

title: 40 jobs AI can’t replace in 2025: Microsoft Research reveals findings; is your career safe?
content: A new Microsoft Research study reveals 40 jobs AI can't replace in 2025 — roles demanding physical precision, real-world judgement, and human connection. From phlebotomists to roofers and surgical assistants, these careers resist automation. For students, this is a signal to explore healthcare, skilled trades, and emotionally intelligent professions where human expertise still outpaces AI.

title: 24 houses, multiple vehicles: Lokayukta raids home of ex-clerk earning Rs 15k
content: A former clerk in Koppal, earning a modest salary, is under investigation for amassing approximately Rs 30 crore in assets through alleged corruption within KRIDL. Lokayukta officials raided his residence, uncovering numerous properties and implicating him in a Rs 72 crore misappropriation scheme involving fabricated project documents. Investigations are ongoing, with promises of action against all involved parties.

title: 10 most powerful earthquakes in the world: Kamchatka Quake joins history’s deadliest list
content: The world has witnessed several catastrophic earthquakes, with the 1960 Valdivia, Chile quake topping the list at magnitude 9.5. These seismic events, including those in Alaska, Sumatra, and Japan, have triggered devastating tsunamis, widespread destruction, and significant loss of life. The recent 8.8 magnitude quake in Kamchatka Peninsula in 2025 has revived discussions about seismic preparedness and disaster response.

title: Friendship day: Best messages, quotes, wishes to share
content: Friendship Day 2025 is approaching, offering a chance to strengthen bonds with cherished friends. The day encourages reconnecting with old acquaintances, expressing gratitude to current companions, and celebrating meaningful relationships through heartfelt gestures. From sharing nostalgic photos to planning themed parties or virtual meetups, the focus remains on appreciating the invaluable role friends play in life's journey.

title: 13-year-old girl forced to marry 40-year-old man in Andhra
content: In Hyderabad, police have filed a case against a 40-year-old man for allegedly marrying a 13-year-old girl. The incident surfaced after the minor confided in her teacher about being forced into the marriage by her mother in May. Authorities have booked the groom, the girl's mother, and attendees under the Prohibition of Child Marriage Act.

title: Trump tariff impact? Oil refiners stop Russia oil purchases in spot market
content: Following US tariffs on Indian exports due to trade ties with Russia, state-owned refiners like IOCL, BPCL, HPCL, and MRPL have reportedly ceased spot market purchases of Russian crude oil. Reliance Industries and Nayara Energy, with term agreements, may continue imports. This shift could raise costs and impact refining margins, though India can transition to alternative sources.

title: 'System is broken': Kamala Harris hints at stepping away from politics
content: Former US Vice President Kamala Harris, in a recent interview, revealed her decision to step away from politics, including declining to run for California governor, citing a belief that the political system is "broken." Despite leading in early polls, Harris expressed concerns about the system's ability to uphold fundamental democratic principles.

title: 'Won’t spare anyone': Rahul accuses EC of 'vote chori' for BJP; claims to have proof
content: Rahul Gandhi has accused the Election Commission of India of "vote theft," claiming to possess irrefutable evidence. He alleges the EC is working for the BJP to manipulate votes, citing suspicions from past elections in Madhya Pradesh, Lok Sabha, and Maharashtra. Gandhi warned of exposing this alleged misconduct, deeming it treasonous and promising accountability for those involved.

title: 'Not the case': Tharoor on Trump's 'dead economy' jab; counters Rahul again
content: Shashi Tharoor contradicted Rahul Gandhi's agreement with Donald Trump's assessment of the Indian economy. While Rahul Gandhi claimed PM Modi had "killed" the economy, Tharoor stated that this was not the case. Trump had suggested India and Russia could "take their dead economies down together," a statement Rahul Gandhi supported.

title: Who will succeed Dhankhar? VP election on September 9
content: The Election Commission of India has declared that the election for the Vice President of India is scheduled for September 9, 2025. As per the ECI's released schedule, the deadline for submitting nominations is August 21. The counting of votes will occur on the same day as the election, September 9.

title: 'No support in male-dominated society': Divya becomes India’s 4th female GM; but why so few?
content: Divya Deshmukh's Grandmaster title highlights a gender disparity in Indian chess. Only four Indian women have achieved this rank, compared to over eighty men. Experts cite societal pressures, lack of support, and financial constraints as key factors. They emphasize the need for inclusive policies, coaching, and financial aid. This will encourage more women to pursue chess professionally.

title: IND vs ENG: Lancashire explain why they removed Pakistan jersey fan - it wasn't due to his T-shirt
content: Lancashire Cricket Club apologised after a fan wearing a Pakistan jersey was removed from Old Trafford during the India-England Test. The club cited prior tensions between fans, including an incident involving a Pakistan flag, as influencing their decision. They claimed the fan's removal wasn't solely due to the jersey but his behaviour after being asked to cover it.

title: ‘Coerced to bury 100 bodies’: SIT finds 15 bones in Dharmasthala forest pit
content: A Special Investigation Team (SIT) in Dharmasthala unearthed partial skeletal remains, suspected to be of a man, from a sixth burial site identified by a complainant alleging mass burials. The remains, found near the Netravathi river, included 15 bones.

title: Why be touchy? SC on defamation case against Tharoor over 'scorpion' remark on PM Modi
content: The Supreme Court considered closing the criminal defamation case against Shashi Tharoor over his "scorpion on a Shivling" remark about Narendra Modi. While Tharoor sought adjournment, the complainant wanted a hearing, but the bench suggested dismissing the case, emphasizing tolerance among political figures. The court eventually scheduled the matter for another day, maintaining a previous order that had suspended proceedings.

title: Former PM Devegowda's grandson Prajwal Revanna convicted for raping domestic help
content: Prajwal Revanna, former MP and grandson of ex-PM HD Devegowda, has been convicted by a special court for raping a 47-year-old domestic help. This conviction pertains to one of the four rape cases filed against him. The court had earlier charged Revanna under various sections of the IPC and IT Act, including rape, sexual harassment, voyeurism, and destruction of evidence.

title: UPI new rules: New NPCI changes kick in from Aug 1 - All you need to know
content: UPI new rules 2025: Starting August 1, 2025, UPI transactions will undergo key changes aimed at boosting efficiency and security. The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) is capping balance inquiries and limiting bank account access via API to prevent system overload. Restrictions on UPI Autopay during peak hours will also be implemented.

title: Kamala recounts painful experience of losing to Trump: Watch
content: Kamala Harris, in her first public appearance since losing the 2024 election, joined Stephen Colbert to discuss her new memoir, '107 Days.' She reflected on certifying the election results and expressed disappointment in the political system's capitulation to Trump's agenda. Harris also hinted at disillusionment with institutional politics and her decision to step away from seeking office.

title: 'Massive oils reserve deal': US to ship crude to Pak soon - Why it matters
content: Pakistan is poised to receive its first-ever US crude oil shipment later this year, marking a significant trade agreement following tariff discussions. Cnergyico, Pakistan's largest refinery, has finalized a deal with Vitol to import 1 million barrels of American oil, aiming to diversify its procurement sources and reduce reliance on Middle Eastern suppliers.

title: Football: Lionel Messi to visit India in December - complete schedule
content: Football icon Lionel Messi is set to visit Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium on December 14 for a ticketed event. The Mumbai Cricket Association has granted permission, and superstar cricketers may also attend. Messi's India tour includes visits to Kolkata and Delhi, with a potential felicitation by West Bengal's Chief Minister. He may also conduct football workshops.

title: SSC exam glitches spark protest: Here’s why #SSCMisManagement is trending
content: Widespread disruptions during the SSC Selection Post Phase 13 exams have ignited nationwide protests. Aspirants and educators are alleging abrupt cancellations, technical glitches, and mistreatment at exam centers, pointing to systemic failures by the Staff Selection Commission. Students are demanding an investigation, vendor contract review, and systemic reforms to ensure fair recruitment practices.

title: 'Saiyaara' Box Office collection: Mohit Suri's movie slows down
content: Since its release on July 18th, 'Saiyaara' dominated the box office, earning ₹172.75 crore in its first week and ₹107.75 crore in the second. However, its momentum slowed as 'Mahavtar Narsimha' gained popularity, especially among families. By day 15, 'Saiyaara's' total collection reached ₹280.73 crore.

title: Trump tariffs: Most and least affected countries- does India make it to either list?
content: In a significant move, the US has unveiled revised global tariff rates, impacting numerous nations and the EU. President Trump's Executive Order imposes tariffs from 10% to over 41%, factoring in geopolitical risks and trade imbalances. Syria, Laos, and Myanmar face the highest levies, while the UK and Brazil receive preferential 10% rates.

title: Watch: Andhra minister’s brother slaps cop at temple; arrested
content: During a temple inauguration in Andhra Pradesh's Nandyal district, BC Janardhan Reddy's brother, Madana Bhoopal Reddy, slapped a police constable on duty. The incident, captured on video, triggered public outrage and led to Bhoopal Reddy's arrest. Minister Janardhan Reddy condemned the act, assuring that those responsible would face legal consequences, emphasizing the government's intolerance for such behavior.

title: ‘Get up or I’ll get you up’: Flight passenger slapped for refusing to give up seat
content: A shocking incident occurred at Bogota's El Dorado International Airport. Hector Santacruz slapped Claudia Segura for refusing to give up a seat. The incident led to a large brawl among travellers. Segura was injured and received medical attention. Santacruz was arrested by airport security. His wife apologized for his actions on social media. The incident has sparked outrage online.

title: Noida student expelled for poor attendance kidnaps minor girl
content: In Noida, Monu Yadav was arrested for kidnapping a class 12 student from outside her school. The girl was rescued. Yadav, a former student expelled for poor attendance, forcibly took the girl in his car. CCTV footage captured the incident. Police filed a case and formed teams to locate the accused and the girl.

title: DU introduces pause-and-resume option; here's how NEP rule will work
content: Delhi University has introduced the Multiple Entry and Multiple Exit (ME-ME) scheme under NEP 2020, allowing undergraduate students to pause and resume their degrees after completing any even semester. Credits remain valid for up to seven years, enabling students to re-enter without academic loss. This flexible structure aims to support diverse student needs and reduce dropout rates.

title: Football: Khalid Jamil appointed India manager, first Indian in 13 years
content: Khalid Jamil has been named the head coach of the Indian national men's football team, marking the first time in 13 years an Indian has held the position. The AIFF executive committee chose the former India international from a shortlist, succeeding Manolo Marquez. Jamil's first challenge will be the CAFA Nations Cup in Tajikistan and Uzbekistan, starting August 29.

title: IND vs ENG: Nair earns plaudits for sportsmanship, stops for injured Woakes
content: During the India versus England 5th Test, Karun Nair displayed sportsmanship when Chris Woakes injured his shoulder while fielding. Nair refrained from taking an extra run out of respect. Woakes' injury appears serious, potentially ending his series. Gus Atkinson expressed concern and readiness to step in. Woakes has had a challenging series, taking only 11 wickets.

title: Himachal rain fury: Landslide near Pandoh Dam shuts Mandi-Kullu Highway
content: Heavy rainfall continues to wreak havoc in Himachal Pradesh, triggering a landslide near Pandoh Dam that shut down the Mandi-Kullu section of the Chandigarh-Manali Highway. Hundreds of roads remain blocked, with Mandi district being the worst hit. Rising river levels prompted the opening of Kol Dam floodgates.

title: After denied debut in 5th Test, India pacer Arshdeep poses with family in London - see pic
content: India's team selection for the final Test against England at The Oval sparked debate, especially regarding Arshdeep Singh's continued absence despite regaining fitness. While Arshdeep remained patient, Kuldeep Yadav and Abhimanyu Easwaran also awaited their opportunities. Ultimately, India opted for a pace-heavy attack, reflecting the recent dominance of fast bowlers at The Oval, as they aimed to level the series.

title: NYC shooting victims honored before HOF game
content: The NFL held a moment of silence before Thursday's Hall of Fame Game to honor the four people killed earlier this week by a shooter who was targeting league headquarters in New York.

title: Correa returning to Astros, this time to play 3B
content: Carlos Correa is returning to the Astros, with the veteran waiving his no-trade clause in order to return to his previous home of seven seasons. Houston also acquired OF Jesus Sanchez from the Marlins.

title: Sources: Stanford to hire ex-Nike CEO as AD
content: Stanford is set to hire former Nike CEO John Donahoe as the school's new athletic director, sources told ESPN on Thursday.

title: Braves explode for 8, then allow 8 in historic inning
content: The Braves and Reds combined for 16 runs on 16 hits in the eighth inning Thursday night, marking just the third time in MLB history that both teams scored eight or more runs in the same inning.

title: Knicks, Bridges agree to 4-year, $150M extension
content: New York Knicks forward Mikal Bridges has agreed to a four-year, $150 million contract extension with the franchise, his agents told ESPN's Shams Charania on Thursday.

title: Tiger's son step closer to Junior Ryder Cup spot
content: Charlie Woods remained in the hunt for one of two automatic qualifying spots for the U.S. Junior Ryder Cup team after shooting a 5-under 66 at the Junior PGA Championship Thursday. He's tied for second overall.

title: China's Yu, 12, wins relay bronze at swim worlds
content: At just 12 years old, Yu Zidi won a bronze medal Thursday by swimming in the prelims of China's 4x200-meter freestyle relay team at the swim world championships.

title: Who makes the Year 2 leap? The top 10 sophomores to watch for the 2025-26 NBA season
content: From top 10 picks to Year 1 breakouts, who are the most interesting players to watch in their sophomore season?

title: New Hall of Famer Antonio Gates was a beloved teammate, remains a San Diego legend
content: Gates transformed the tight end position, and he remains remarkable to those who witnessed his exploits.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Newcastle eye Woltemade
content: Both Manchester United and Newcastle United are looking to sign Stuttgart forward Nick Woltemade. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Premier League 2025-26 kit ranking: Every new jersey released so far
content: Why should you have to wait until all of the Premier League kits are out before you see them ranked? Here's every 2025-26 jersey that's been released.

title: Red Sox add to staff, acquire May from Dodgers
content: The Red Sox acquired starter Dustin May from the Dodgers on Thursday, filling their need for pitching help. Los Angeles received outfield prospect James Tibbs III in return.

title: Rangers get Kelly from D-backs to add to rotation
content: The Rangers are acquiring right-handed starting pitcher Merrill Kelly from the Diamondbacks in exchange for three pitchers, sources told ESPN.

title: Rays add White Sox's Houser, Twins' Jax to staff
content: Adrian Houser, who was released by the Rangers and has shined since being picked up by the White Sox, has now been traded to the Rays, who also picked up Griffin Jax from the Twins for Taj Bradley.

title: Phillies fill outfield need, get Bader from Twins
content: The Phillies filled a need in their outfield by acquiring 2021 Gold Glove-winner Harrison Bader from the Twins.

title: Padres acquire closer Miller, lefty Sears from A's
content: The San Diego Padres have acquired Mason Miller in a trade with the Athletics, adding the hard-throwing reliever to their already talented bullpen.

title: Mariners land slugging 3B Suarez from D-backs
content: The Mariners have acquired slugging third baseman Eugenio Suárez from the Diamondbacks in exchange for three prospects.

title: Cubs add righty Soroka, send 2 prospects to Nats
content: The Cubs acquired pitcher Mike Soroka from the Nationals for two prospects and reliever Andrew Kittredge from the Orioles for another prospect.

title: It's time for The Ocho! Check out the 2025 schedule, plus how to watch every event
content: It's time for the 2025 edition of The Ocho! Check out how to watch T-Rex races, paintball, dog surfing and more alternative events on ESPN now.

title: The real most valuable players on every NFL team: Who would return multiple first-round picks via trade?
content: This exhaustive NFL trade guide factors in ability, positional value, contracts and age to figure out which players are really worth a first-round pick.

title: Five trades that make too much sense: Which teams should make a deal now?
content: As teams look to finalize their rosters, Seth Walder proposes trades that could help all sides involved.

title: Wetzel: Next NFLPA boss should understand the job
content: NFLPA adventure with Howell shows the union has lost focus in finding leaders driven to represent labor.

title: How billionaire Mike Repole plans to change the vibe of the UFL, expand it to 16 teams
content: MIke Repole is taking over business operations for the UFL and promises market changes and a livelier product.

title: What to know ahead of the Hungarian Grand Prix
content: Formula 1 heads to Budapest for round 14 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the last race weekend before the summer break.

title: NASCAR taking shots in experimentation and making many of them
content: The NASCAR schedule used to be predictable. Now, though, it's constantly evolving, and the series deserves credit for its bravery.

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Taira can avoid an upset loss at UFC Fight Night
content: Din Thomas makes his pick for Taira vs. Park and a betting insider finds value bets on this weekend's MMA cards.

title: Boxing real or not: Joshua vs. Paul? Can Pacquiao win a title? Who's the best featherweight?
content: Nick Parkinson discusses what could be next for Anthony Joshua, Manny Pacquiao, Teofimo Lopez and Oleksandr Usyk.

title: "Rahul Gandhi Not A Child, Should Not Harm Nation's Image": Kiren Rijiju
content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Friday hit out at Congress MP Rahul Gandhi for echoing US President Donald Trump's criticisms of the Indian economy, saying he is "not a child" and should understand the country's image cannot be harmed this way

title: "Baseless Allegations": Poll Body On Rahul Gandhi's Voter Fraud Claims
content: Pushing back against Rahul Gandhi's fresh allegations of "vote theft", the Election Commission of India has termed the Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha's remarks "baseless".

title: No F-35 Fighter Jets Discussions With US: Centre To Lok Sabha
content: The Centre has told the Lok Sabha that no formal discussions have taken place with the United States regarding the purchase of F-35 fifth-generation fighter jets.

title: Thailand Sends Back 2 Cambodian Soldiers Ahead Of Key Border Ceasefire Talks
content: Thailand's army sent home two Cambodian soldiers from a group of 20 on Friday, ahead of a key meeting in Malaysia next week where defence ministers and military commanders will hold talks aimed at maintaining a ceasefire along their disputed border.

title: "Sci-Fi Movie": Baby Born From 30-Year-Old Frozen Embryo
content: In 1994, Linda Archerd used IVF to create the embryo and chose Tim Pierce through a Christian adoption agency.

title: "We Were Asked To Arrest RSS Chief": Massive Claim By Malegaon Case Officer
content: Retired IPS officer Param Bir Singh had ordered the arrest of RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat after a blast in Maharashtra's Malegaon claimed six lives in 2008, former Maharashtra Anti-Terror Squad (ATS) officer Mehboob Mujawar said.

title: Madras High Court Bars Use Of Living Leaders' Names In Government Schemes
content: The Madras High Court has directed the Tamil Nadu government that while launching and operating welfare schemes through various advertisements, the name of any living leaders or party insignia/emblem/flag shall not be included.

title: Nara Lokesh Accuses Jagan Reddy Party Of Cancelling Agreements With Singapore
content: Andhra Pradesh IT Minister Nara Lokesh launched a scathing attack on the previous YSR Congress Party (YSRCP) government, accusing it of systematically destroying the state's brand and obstructing development.

title: Crunching Numbers: How Trump's 25% Tariff Will Impact Indian Markets
content: US President Donald Trump has announced the latest reciprocal tariff rates for trading partners as the August 1 deadline came to an end on Friday.

title: UP Man Kills Wife, Tries To Pass It Off As Robbery, Arrested
content: In a chilling incident in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly district, a man allegedly killed his wife at the behest of his lover and tried to pass it off as a highway robbery, police said.

title: Ex-MP Prajwal Revanna Found Guilty Of Sexually Assaulting House Help
content: The special court for MPs/MLAs in Bengaluru said it will announce the quantum of punishment against Prajwal Revanna on Saturday.

title: Trump's Revised Tariffs: India Remains At 25%, Pak's Rate Slashed
content: US President Donald Trump has signed a new executive order slapping higher tariffs on dozens of trading partners ahead of a Friday trade deal deadline, in his latest bid to reshape global trade in favour of US businesses.

title: "NISAR To Provide Data On Disaster Management, Crop Health": NASA Scientist
content: Project Scientist for the NISAR mission, Dr Paul Rosen, talked about the benefits of the NISAR mission, as it will help provide reliable data on disaster management, agricultural crop health, forest management and other scientific endeavours.

title: Operation Milap: 142 Missing Children, Adults Reunited By Delhi Police
content: In a remarkable display of dedication and compassion, the South-West District Police successfully traced and reunited 142 missing individuals, including 61 children and 81 adults, with their families during the month of July under 'Operation Milap'.

title: "Why So Touchy": Top Court On Shashi Tharoor's "Scorpion On Shivling" Remark
content: The Supreme Court urged BJP leader Rajiv Babbar to close the defamation case against Congress MP Shashi Tharoor over the latter's statement comparing Prime Minister Narendra Modi to a scorpion sitting on a <i>Shivling<i>.

title: "Obstructing Governance": Meitei Alliance Asks Manipur Governor Not To Renew Deal With Kuki Militants
content: The controversial tripartite agreement signed between two dozen Kuki insurgent groups and the Centre and the Manipur government should not be extended due to blatant violation of ground rules by the armed groups, the Meitei Alliance said.

title: Adani Power Clocks 27.1% Sequential Surge At Rs 3,305 Crore In Q1
content: Adani Power on Friday reported an impressive 27.1 per cent sequential surge in the April-June quarter (Q1 FY26) at Rs 3,305 crore -- from Rs 2,599.23 crore posted in the last quarter (Q4 FY25).

title: How US Tariffs Spell Disaster For This Clothing Factory Supplying To US Stores
content: The deafening roar of hundreds of sewing machines has gone silent. Spools of thread in every colour are covered in dust. The warehouse is dark and empty.

title: Statehood Gains Support Abroad, But Remains A Distant Dream For Palestinians
content: Plans announced by France, the United Kingdom and Canada to recognise a Palestinian state won't bring one about anytime soon, though they could further isolate Israel and strengthen the Palestinians' negotiating position over the long term.

title: Trump outburst may help govt counter ‘surrender’ charge; US stance likely to muddy waters
content: Samridhii Shukla’s Top 10 Dreamy Looks 'Son of Sardaar 2' actress Mrunal Thakur’s skincare routine Anushka Shetty glows with timeless charm and quiet strength Inside Neeru Bajwa’s beauty ritual Kubbra Sait’s go-to curly hair routine In Pics: Stylish looks of Mamta Mohandas Rasha Thadani to Tamannaah Bhatia: Bollywood stars who brought their A-game to the ramp Mrunal Thakur’s Promotional Looks for Son of Sardar 2 10 baby boy names inspired by freedom and patriotism 10 Seneca Quotes that will change how you see yourself!

title: 'Ignore such baseless allegations': EC rebuts Rahul's 'vote chori' attack
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: 'Was asked to arrest Mohan Bhagwat': Ex-ATS cop recalls Malegaon blast probe
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Travis Hunter leads Madden NFL 26 rookie ratings
content: EA Sports has released the initial ratings for the NFL's rookie class . the top ten rookies as rated by Madden NFL 26 are the Jacksonville Jaguars cornerback Travis Hunter . Hunter claims the top spot with 84 OVR, sporting high general stats .

title: Mets find CF fix, trade for Orioles veteran Mullins
content: the Mets acquired center fielder cedric Mullins from the Baltimore Orioles . the 30-year-old is set to be a free agent after this season . he's hitting .229 with 15 home runs and a .738 OPS in 91 games for Baltimore .

title: Former Cubs outfielder Matt Szczur pays tribute to Ryne Sandberg with painting
content: former Chicago Cubs outfielder Matt Szczur paid homage to team icon Ryne Sandberg . his most recent project was a tribute to a Hall of Famer who died on Monday at 65 . he has built up a following on Instagram and TikTok (19,200 followers)

title: Wrexham celebrate Wales' connection with Argentina in stunning third kit
content: Wrexham return to the second tier of English football in 2025-26 . the club are just one step below the premier league . a new kit has a distinct inflection of world cup holders Argentina .

title: EA Sports details major solo play changes for Madden NFL 26 Ultimate Team
content: upcoming iteration's Ultimate Team mode will feature a 12-game gauntlet every week . it will be the primary stomping ground for players to tackle challenges with escalating difficulty . the new Solo Champions mode is aimed at making MUT more attractive .

title: PLL Power Rankings entering Week 10: Chaos jump into Top 3
content: the Denver Outlaws and New York Atlas were the first two teams to clinch 2025 playoff spots . they will also face the Chaos on friday (8 p.m. ET, ABC/ESPN+), who rose up my Power Rankings this week . there isn't a weakness on this team and they share the rock .

title: Divisional rankings: Zayas rises; a new king at flyweight
content: Xander Zayas becomes the youngest current world champion at 22 . the 22-year-old takes a wide decision against Jorge Garcia to win the vacant WBO junior middleweight championship . "Shu Shu" Carrington kept his undefeated record intact by beating Mateus Heita .

title: Nunez, Grealish among Premier League stars who need a transfer
content: the start of the 2025-26 premier league season is just two weeks away . the summer transfer window is about to enter its final month . a drop down to less glamorous or successful club could be the best option . click here for all the latest premier league news .

title: Rahul Gandhi's remarks on U.S. tariffs expose his 'anti-India' mindset: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: ''When Prime Minister Narendra Modi is conducting everything so gracefully and talking with various countries on equal terms, Rahul Gandhi is defaming our country,'' CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said

title: Ajit Pawar warns NCP workers against misconduct, says such acts tarnish party image
content: His remarks come in the wake of two recent controversies linked to NCP members, which included an incident in Pune district where the brother of an NCP MLA allegedly fired a gun at a "tamasha" venue in Daund

title: Andhra Pradesh’s real development is possible only with Congress Party: Palak Verma
content: Palak Verma said the assurance on Special Category Status would become a reality only when the Congress was voted to power

title: After NISAR, ISRO gearing up for next U.S. collaboration with BlueBird communications satellite launch
content: BlueBird satellite to be launched from Satish Dhawan Space Centre in Sriharikota on board LVM3, ISRO’s heftiest launch vehicle, formerly known as GSLV-Mk III, says ISRO chairman V. Narayanan

title: Allegations of impotency made by wife in divorce proceedings not defamatory: HC
content: The court dismissed the petitioner's complaint seeking a defamation case against his estranged wife and her family for alleging that he was impotent in the divorce proceedings initiated by her.

title: Tamil Nadu has consistently invested in young minds, says Consul General of Republic of Korea
content: Speaking at the silver jubilee opening ceremony of Patrician College of Arts and Science, Mr. Kim said, there is a great deal of liking for Korean culture in India, whether it is Korean drama, cuisine, or beauty products

title: NDA leaders slam former Andhra CM Jagan Mohan Reddy over his remarks; condemn vindictive politics allegations
content: Anakapalli MP C.M. Ramesh said Jagan Mohan Reddy is deliberately spreading false propaganda to create unrest in Andhra Pradesh

title: ED raids on promoters of defaulting realty project Ozone Urbana in Bengaluru, Mumbai
content: The project, Ozone Urbana Housing Township in Devanahalli taluk, is one of the biggest defaulters of Karnataka Real Estate Regulatory Authority (RERA-K) revenue recovery orders

title: Centre approves ₹125 crore project for landslide mitigation in Uttarakhand
content: Five sensitive sites most frequently hit by landslides have been selected for the project on a priority basis

title: Failure analysis on PSLV-C61/EOS-09 mission completed, report to be submitted to PM soon: ISRO chairman V. Narayanan
content: Narayanan describes the problem as a ‘small’ one, but says he can reveal the details only after the report is submitted to Prime Minister

title: Rapper Vedan moves Kerala High Court seeking anticipatory bail in rape case
content: Case was registered after a young woman doctor approached Kochi DCP with a complaint that Vedan sexually assaulted her in Kochi and Kozhikode on multiple occasions from 2021 to 2023 on the assurance of marriage

title: Kerala Governor spurns reconciliation efforts by LDF govt, reappoints Ciza Thomas and K. Sivaprasad as DUK, KTU interim V-Cs
content: Reappointments effectively undermine Kerala government’s attempts to ease growing tensions with Governor, who, in his capacity as Chancellor of State-run universities, has been at odds with the administrative dispensation over various issues

title: What we have found is an ‘atom bomb’; there’s 100% proof EC doing ‘vote chori’ for BJP: Rahul Gandhi
content: It is an open and shut case. The Election Commission is resorting to vote theft for the BJP, says Congress leader Rahul Gandhi

title: No jhuggis will be removed, will amend policies to ensure dignity, housing for all: Delhi CM
content: Delhi is the capital of India and it deserves faster development, better infrastructure, technology, and better lives for its residents. But now, we have a chance to rebuild and make it right, Delhi CM Rekha Gupta

title: Woman taken into custody at Kothamangalam in Kerala after 38-year-old man dies of suspected poisoning
content: According to police, Ansil was reportedly in a relationship with the woman. She had allegedly filed multiple complaints against him for alleged sexual and physical assault earlier. The accused allegedly served him poison with the intention of killing him

title: Law is doing its job: Chhattisgarh CM on nuns' arrest for 'human trafficking'
content: The matter sparked to protests in Parliament on Wednesday, with Congress calling the incident "deeply disturbing and shocking" and sought the Centre's intervention in the matter

title: ED searches in 'fake' bank guarantee racket; Anil Ambani group company under radar
content: A Reliance Group spokesperson said Reliance Power has been a "victim of fraud, forgery and cheating conspiracy" in this case and it has made due disclosures in this context to the stock exchanges on November 7, 2024.

title: U.S. officials, including Ricky Gill to visit India for IMEC infrastructure corridor
content: A transcontinental India-Middle East-Europe Corridor (IMEC) was announced on the sidelines of the G20 summit in New Delhi in September 2023.

title: Need to make Sanskrit a medium of communication: RSS chief Bhagwat
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat emphasises the importance of Sanskrit as the origin of Indian languages and the need for its widespread use

title: ‘Ungaludan Stalin’: Madras High Court restrains T.N. government from naming new schemes after living personalities
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice Sunder Mohan also prohibit use of portraits of former Chief Ministers/ideological leaders and DMK insignia in government advertisements

title: Bengaluru 13-year-old boy murder: Police open fire and arrest two kidnapper-killers
content: One of the arrested persons was reportedly working as a driver earlier, and is known to the boy and his parents

title: Uttarakhand CM Dhami orders inquiry into toddler's death due to delayed medical help
content: The child was allegedly referred from one medical facility to another several times before being admitted to a hospital in Haldwani, where he died after a few days of treatment.

title: NISAR mission enters critical 90-day commissioning phase
content: The critical phase follows the successful launch of the radar imaging satellite on July 30 aboard a GSLV-F16 rocket from Srikharikota in Andhra Pradesh.

title: Opposition leaders request Lok Sabha discussion on Bihar electoral roll revision
content: The revision of electoral rolls has direct implications on the right to vote and the conduct of free and fair elections, the Opposition MPs said

title: Indian economy devastated by five Modi-inflicted shocks: Congress
content: Jairam Ramesh claimed that the record imports from China have led to the closure of lakhs of MSMEs across the country — in Gujarat alone, around a third of the MSMEs in the stainless steel industry have shut down their operations.

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Texas Tech's big moves land it in the top 25
content: at least four top-50 prospects are expected to make announcements over the next month . the top classes could see some more big changes before week 1 kicks off . OT Keenyi Pepe has double-digit ESPN 300 commits, with several joining the list .

title: BJP, Sangh Parivar promoting hate and divisive politics for electoral gains: K.C. Venugopal
content: He accuses Centre of orchestrating a ‘political drama’ over arrest and delayed release of two Keralite nuns in Chhattisgarh

title: Exclusion of women political workers from POSH Act: Supreme Court allows Yogamaya to withdraw petition
content: A Bench headed by Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai said the petitioner could take other necessary steps in accordance with the law.

title: Services at AIIMS-Patna affected as resident doctors boycott work over MLA's 'high-handedness'
content: In a letter to the medical superintendent of AIIMS-Patna, the Resident Doctors' Association sought legal action against Chetan Anand and the deployment of security personnel on the hospital premises

title: Telangana Monsoon 2025 | Normal to above normal rainfall in August and September: IMD
content: In terms of temperatures, the forecast indicates that maximum temperatures across Telangana are expected to remain normal to slightly above normal in August

title: Prajwal Revanna rape case verdict: A complete timeline of events
content: The case concerns a 48-year-old woman who was working as a help at the family’s Gannikada farmhouse in Hassan and was allegedly raped twice by the former JD(S) MP.

title: Devaswom clerk suspended for stealing money during treasury counting at temple in Kerala’s Kannur
content: CCTV visuals revealed that Mullappally Narayanan of Cheriyoor, an LD clerk at the temple, stole the money

title: Disaster management mock drill carried out at 55 locations across Delhi
content: The exercise began with the triggering of a simulated earthquake scenario followed by chemical leaks in industrial and transport zones in all the 11 districts

title: Delhi CM launches month-long cleanliness drive 'Dilli ko kude se azaadi'
content: Hitting out at the previous AAP government, CM Rekha Gupta said they “spent crores of rupees on building Sheesh Mahal” but did not do anything to improve the condition of government offices.

title: Good to see Omar Abdullah enjoying visit to Statue of Unity: PM Modi
content: Jammu and Kashmir CM Abdullah posted pictures of his morning run at the famed Sabarmati River Front promenade.

title: Hot air balloon rides in Delhi in next two months, boost to ecotourism
content: The locations where hot air balloon rides will start are Yamuna Sports Complex, Commonwealth Games Sports Complex, Asita, and Baansera Park

title: The silent engine behind every cancer cure: why everyone should care about research
content: Participating in studies, advocating for research funding, donating to medical science, or simply asking doctors about the latest evidence -- these actions collectively strengthen the ecosystem that advances cancer care

title: 2018 Abirami case: How a T.N. court reasoned against death penalty for mother who poisoned her two children in Chennai: Explained
content: What was the prosecution’s case? How did the police corroborate the evidence? Did the woman confess to have committed the crime? Which of the factors convinced the trial court with respect to her guilt? What made the trial judge consciously refrain from awarding capital punishment?

title: Parole of ‘Kodi’ Suni, convict in T.P. Chandrasekharan murder case, cancelled for violation of conditions
content: Police say as per parole conditions, Suni should have stayed within Meenangadi police station limits. But after reporting once, he was found staying in a resort within Kenichira police station limits, bordering Kannur and Wayanad

title: Centre will support highway upgrade in north Karnataka, says Belagavi MP Jagadish Shettar
content: The Union Minister told BJP MP Jagadish Shettar that the projects will be cleared on a case-by- case basis, depending on how fast the government of Karnataka moves with the projects

title: ‘Anything that moves, NASA-ISRO satellite will see with unprecedented fidelity’
content: A conversation with Karen St. Germain, director of the Earth Science Division at NASA’s Science Mission Directorate, on the ‘extraordinary new capability’ NISAR represents for ISRO and NASA

title: India cannot remain ‘mute spectator’ as institutions like WTO are destroyed, says Congress
content: Congress general secretary in-charge communications Jairam Ramesh said the World Trade Organisation (WTO) had been dealt very heavy blows during Mr. Trump-I

title: AIDSO demands impartial probe into death of Odisha student at Central University of Karnataka in Kalaburagi
content: AIDSO expressed deep shock over the growing number of student deaths in Central universities and institutions of higher learning across India

title: Amarnath Yatra from Jammu remains suspended for second day on August 1
content: Over 4 lakh pilgrims have paid obeisance at the ice lingam of Lord Shiva at the 3,880-meter-high cave shrine since the 38-day pilgrimage commenced on July 3 from the Valley

title: Enforcement Directorate raids against fake call centres in Delhi duping U.S. citizens
content: Three premises in Khanpur were raided around 10:30 p.m. July 31, 2025 and the searches are still going on

title: Cambodia-based job frauds continue to haunt Visakhapatnam youth
content: In the latest case, 10 people are reportedly being forced into cybercrimes in Thailand; over 150 people from Vizag are still caught in such rackets abroad, say police

title: The fading sound of kombu
content: The sound of this wind instrument may have reverberated across  the battlefields of Tamil land. Nowadays, it is played only at temple festivals. Kombu artistes urge the government to give more aid and take steps to encourage the youth to take up the art form

title: Pathiri mango: a variety introduced by German missionary in Mayiladuthurai
content: The Pathiri variety is to unique to Mayiladuthurai and the surrounding areas. The name is short for Pathiriyar, the Tamil word for a Christian priest. Rev. Ochs, a German missionary and pastor of the Tamil Evangelical Lutheran Church Holy Immanuel Church, came to Mayiladuthurai in 1845. He was the first to plant the sapling of this variety

title: Over 22,000 ryots certified for cultivating organic produce in Andhra Pradesh
content: The certification has enabled the production of over 1.5 lakh metric tonnes of certified organic and good agricultural produce, unlocking access to domestic and international markets

title: Loan ‘fraud’: Enforcement Directorate summons Anil Ambani for questioning on August 5
content: The agency will record his statement under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) once he deposes, they said.

title: Tracing the naval prowess of Rajendra Chola I — from Eelamandalam to Kadaram
content: His reign marked the most assertive phase of Chola overseas ambition. The naval campaigns during this period led to the annexation of Sri Lanka and an audacious expedition across the Bay of Bengal to the distant shores of the Malay Peninsula. The defeat of Malay Peninsula earned Rajendra the title Kadaram Kondan

title: Vrikshabandhan: An annual ritual in Visakhapatnam to tie rakhis around trees
content: An annual ritual in Visakhapatnam, Vrikshabandhan involves tying rakhis to trees as a gesture of respect and commitment to preserve them

title: Workplace wellness: Sound bath therapy rises in corporate India
content: Now, work on your emotional wellbeing at the office. Companies across India, from IT to design, are adding sound baths to structured team-building exercises for employees

title: Lost song of the Sundarbans’ fisherfolk
content: Dwindling incomes from fishing and the resultant migration of fishermen to states like Kerala and Andhra Pradesh is taking a toll on the folk arts of West Bengal

title: The lives of inland fisherfolk in Tamil Nadu
content: In Southern and Western Tamil Nadu, inland fishermen use simple tools and a work ethic that does not exploit nature’s resources

title: Documentary project Recipes of the River looks at the ancient wisdom of the Goan river-fishing community
content: Photographer Assavri Kulkarni’s project assumes greater importance at a time when fish is being eaten out of season

title: In Bengaluru, meter off, fares up
content: The Regional Transport Authority of Bengaluru Urban district revised auto fares in the city limits on July 14, with the new rates coming into effect from August 1. While auto drivers are unhappy with the increase, commuters question the relevance of the decision when meters are hardly used and surge pricing by app-based aggregators is the norm

title: Review: Bride in the Hills | A Kuvempu magnum opus for the English reader
content: Set in the late 19th-century, this recent translation of the legendary Kannada writer’s 1967 novel is an exemplary work of social realism

title: Fishing in Kashmir, beneath the ice sheaths
content: Adept with harpoons in winter and nets in summer, the fishing communities here are relying on the government to save their lakes

title: Agrarian Rayalaseema’s dream for an industrial future
content: As mega industrial corridors and expressways reshape Rayalaseema’s landscape, an industrial future is poised to dawn over the region, which is grappling with declining agriculture and rising unemployment. The transformation has spurred interest in Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises among the youth, with many already scripting success. K. Umashanker speaks to the farmers who parted with their land for infrastructure development and the entrepreneurs betting big on economic boom

title: Cherlapalli Railway terminal: All aboard the hype, but mind the gaps
content: Inaugurated with much fanfare as Hyderabad’s next big rail hub, the ₹430-crore Cherlapalli terminal was envisioned as a modern, congestion-busting alternative to Secunderabad station. But seven months after opening, the terminal remains hobbled by poor access roads, inadequate public transport, incomplete infrastructure and a disconnect between vision and execution. While the facade screams ambition, the functionality is far from future-ready, finds V. Geetanath

title: Export Facilitation Centres supporting MSMEs, says Union Minister
content: In Andhra Pradesh alone, 50 MSMEs received support through the EFCs during 2024–25, Ms.  Karandlaje said

title: Silence in the service lanes: Bengali migrants of Gurugram live in fear amid police verification drives
content: According to those living in the shadows of the city’s high-rise structures, the ongoing raids target Bengali-speaking migrants employed in the informal sector

title: Tirunelveli caste killing: Subhashini acknowledges relationship with victim Kavin, says parents ‘innocent’
content: According to her, Surjith wanted Kavin to meet her parents as he felt her marriage would pave way for his “progress”

title: Supreme Court dismisses anticipatory bail of IPS officer Sanjay, asks him to surrender in three weeks
content: ACB booked a case against him for ‘manipulating’ tender processes while he was Director General of A.P. State Disaster Response & Fire Services

title: False cases being filed against YSRCP leaders for questioning govt., alleges Jagan
content: The YSRCP chief calls on former MLAs — Kakani Govardhan Reddy in prison and Prasanna Kumar Reddy at his residence

title: Babulal Marandi accuses Hemant Soren government of falsely implicating Hindu leaders
content: During the monsoon session starting from August 1, the Jharkhand government will present the first supplementary budget of the current financial year as well as several bills including the University Bill-2025 in the House.

title: Gujar youth was killed in cold blood: Mehbooba
content: The killing of Parvez is part of a chilling pattern of violence, with over a dozen Gujjar-Bakerwal men dying in suspicious circumstances in 2024-25, the former CM said

title: Tusker tramples three to death in Odisha
content: Villagers allege the precise locations of wild elephants are not being communicated to them  effectively

title: Tripartite river management project between West Bengal, Bihar, Jharkhand in the works: West Bengal Minister
content: West Bengal Minister Manas Ranjan Bhunia said the proposed project aims to control soil erosion by the Ganga in Malda, close to the Bihar and Jharkhand borders

title: BSP chief Mayawati slams United States trade tariffs, urges Union govt. to use it as opportunity for self-reliance
content: United States President Donald Trump on July 30 announced a 25% tariff on Indian goods from August 1, with an additional but unspecified “penalty” for its defence and energy imports from Russia

title: CBSE delinks building of more classes from land availability
content: The construction of sections or classes will be linked to the total built-up carpet area of the school building instead of land acreage

title: Mohan Majhi Govt to plant 75 lakh saplings in a single day to celebrate birthday of PM Narendra Modi
content: Odisha CM emphasised planting of climate-resilient and fruit-bearing species, tailored to local ecological conditions

title: Rajbhar’s Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party decides to contest Bihar election
content: The two term MLA and cabinet minister in Uttar Pradesh government, Mr. Rajbhar asserted that he is in talks with the NDA but if not given respectable seats then ready to go solo.

title: No school closure, no post cuts on cards, U.P. Minister clarifies over school merger
content: The Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav claimed that the government was forced to take back the decision due to the opposition pressure and protest

title: Insurance RB rankings: Charbonnet, Guerendo lead the way
content: Zach Charbonnet is a priority insurance running back for fantasy managers . this concept applies to fantasy football . he was rostered in just 22% of ESPN leagues entering Week 1 . but he emerged as a league winner after the Buccaneers' week 11 bye .

title: MLB trade deadline recap: Correa to Astros and all the moves that rocked deadline day
content: the 2025 trade deadline has officially passed, with contending teams making a flurry of late moves before 6 p.m. ET arrived . the San Diego Padres made a blockbuster move ahead of deadline day with a late-night deal with the Arizona Diamondbacks for Eugenio Suarez .

title: Source: Commanders' McLaurin requests trade
content: a source says Terry McLaurin has requested a trade . he was frustrated with negotiations on a contract extension . there has been no movement toward a new deal, one source says . the commanders receiver could no longer be fined $50,000 per day .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Jags' Thomas, Lawrence working on connection
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL, and our 32 team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room .

title: Free agency Power Rankings: Where the Rockets, Raptors and others land
content: the 2025-26 offseason is in full swing . some teams are settling in with their newly acquired superstars . the Houston Rockets acquired 15-time All-Star Kevin Durant from the Phoenix Suns in June . other veteran names were also on the move this offseason .

title: 🏈 CFB's toughest and easiest schedules for '25
content: college football is for the first time in history sharing revenue with athletes . the start of the 2025 season is less than a month away . it's time to hand out some superlatives, some flattering and some not so flattering .

title: MLB trade deadline winners and losers: What we loved -- and don't understand
content: this year's deadline didn't have star players on the move, like Juan Soto in 2022, or the volume of last year . we did have two shocking trades: the Astros brought back former star Carlos Correa . the Athletics traded closer Mason Miller to the Padres for leo de Vries .
